summary: Email correspondence between Assistant U.S. Attorney and attorney Larry Fallek regarding potential testimony in the Ghislaine Maxwell trial. Fallek inquires if he will be needed to testify and provides his availability around the holidays.

persons.name: Larry Fallek
persons.context: Attorney at Fallek & Fallek, PLLC who is inquiring about whether he will be needed to testify at the Ghislaine Maxwell trial and provides his travel plans.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the trial 'United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell' for which testimony is being discussed.

connections.description: Fallek is a potential witness in the trial against Ghislaine Maxwell, indicating some form of legal or case-related connection.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Trial Preparation
events.description: U.S. Attorney's Office is working on the trial in United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell and contacting potential witnesses.

events.title: Larry Fallek's Planned Trip
events.description: Larry Fallek plans to visit his son in Atlanta during these dates, which could affect his availability to testify.

locations: 116 East 65th Street LLC (referenced in case name)
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively preparing for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial as of December 2021.
Attorney Larry Fallek was a potential witness in the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.
The email correspondence shows coordination between prosecutors and potential witnesses regarding trial logistics and availability.
The case referenced is 'Barr v. 116 East 65th Street LLC', which appears to be related to the Maxwell proceedings.
The communication highlights the ongoing legal proceedings against Ghislaine Maxwell years after Jeffrey Epstein's death.
